Header: Rehearsal to control fuel spilt in the sea
Content: A rehearsal program to control fuel spilt in the sea was conducted by the Marine Environment Protection Authority. It was headed by Rear Admiral Rohana Perera. The Disaster Management Centre conducted the awareness management workshop and rehearsal. It was decided to carry out field inspections at Wellawatte and Mt Lavinia coastal areas, assuming 150 tons of fuel was leaked off the coast of Colombo. The Police, the Coast Guard, the Petroleum Corporation, Central Environment Authority and a large number of other organizations supported them.
